p:
A maximum of 15 participants were recruited per facility per week. Demographic and clinical history details of the participants were collected from eligible patients as described previously
30 . A NPS sample was collected by inserting a sterile nylon flocked plastic-shafted swab (503CS01, Copan Diagnostics, Flocked Swab Technologies, Italy) into one nostril to a distance where the tip located the deep nasopharynx and twisting 3 times before gently removing (taking 5–10 seconds). The NPS sample was stored in universal virus transport media and kept at approximately 8°C in an ice packed cool box. It was then delivered to the KEMRI–Wellcome Trust Research Programme laboratories approximately 4 hours after collection and stored at −80°C.
